rdfs:label: Abstract machine notation
ns:common.topic.description: The abstract machine notation is a specification language and programming language for specifying abstract machines in the B method, based on the mathematical theory of generalised substitutions.

ns:common.document.text: The abstract machine notation (AMN) is a specification language and (abstract) programming language for specifying abstract machines in the B method, based on the mathematical theory of generalised substitutions.\nThis article was originally based on material from the Free On-line Dictionary of Computing, which is licensed under the GFDL.

ns:type.object.name: Abstract machine notation
